steps.step: Sterilize a canning jar large enough to hold currants and brandy.
Wash and stem currants, and remove mouldy ones.
Add currants and brandy to jar and seal.
Store in a dark place at room temperature 2 months. Occasionally shake the contents gently.
Sterilize a jelly bag and drain the mixture 1 hour.
Squeeze to remove as much liquid as possible. Reserve the solids and make jam by adding equal weight of sugar and some water.
Strain the liquid again through a double layer of cheesecloth.
Combine sugar and water and heat until sugar dissolves. Let cool.
Add sugar syrup to curant liquor to taste.
Bottle, seal, and mature another 2 months.
